review_blob:
Draft @ APEX. Thin, almost non-existent head, very thin lace.
Hazy apricot color.
Spicy and floral aroma, thin palate, reminiscent of a good clean pils.
If you like IPA but need something sessionable, this is your jam.
beer_name: Anderson Valley Wee Geech Pale Ale

review_blob:
Draft @ APEX. Big sweet floral nose, minimal carbonation. Hard to tell what flowers the name alludes to, but my guess is jasmine, honeysuckle, something like that.
Practically no head, thin eggy lace. Hazy golden straw color. Rye bite upfront, but well-balanced by the hop profile, which shows plenty of grapefruit and bready flavors. 
Well-balanced and tight; a rare good hybrid of rye and IPA.

Draft @ APEX. Fine-grained head, pixelated lace in glass.
Piney aroma with lots of intense caramel. Mid-palate is burnt caramel and boozy heat, a bit odd to find at 6.8.   Tight citrus & pepper hop finish.

Served live from the barrel at Cascade Barrel House.  Striking rye aroma upfront, followed quickly by an oaky tang. Color is mahogany, very slight haze (to be expected w/ a live beer.)  Flavor is sweeter than I expected, with a slightly bourbony twist. Mouthfeel is somewhat thin for 8.5%. The finish has the rye tartness and some dryness from the oak barrel. 
A strange hybrid, but should be a winner with rye fans.

22. 
NOTE: the bottle I am rating is a cellared 2009 vintage of this beer, so adjust for aging accordingly!
Flavor has concentrated considerably with age. I drank another bottle of this when it was fresh, and I recall it being super in-your-face resiny & bitter, almost undrinkably so. Im a hops fiend and I could barely finish it.
Woody dry finish, thick caramelly, almost bourbony malt profile. Tastes more like a 9% barleywine than a IIPA. Definitely worth cellaring vs drinking fresh.

Draft @ EastBurn (and many other places in recent years.) 
Big bodacious C-hop bomb IPA, sort of an exemplar of the California IPA style.  Grapefruit & a bit of pine in the nose. Golden color, bit of haze chill, loose head, thin sheets. Peppery snappy malt profile fades to citrusy hop finish.
Hazy straw color, light white head, Nearly no lace. Very slight pineapple aroma and flavor. Bright grassy hop flavor.Mouthfeel is closer to pilsner than IPA.
beer_name: Flat Tail Golden Years Pineapple IPA

review_blob: Draft @ belmont station. Reddish gold color, slight chill haze. Nice rye punch, but not overwhelming, balanced with the hops. Loose eggy lace, cream colored loose head. Rye bread aroma spiked with pepper. Hop profile has grass, pepper and spice, tiny bit of lemon.
beer_name: Widmer Brothers Rotator IPA Series - ORyely IPA

review_blob: Draft @ Belmont Station. Light head fades to loose ring with tiered sheets of lace. Lush grapefruity and orangey hop flavor, slightly catty nose. Clear medium gold color, slightly metallic finish.

Draft @ Saraveza. Deliciously tart but restrained sour, mild cranberry flavor, but mild to non-existent pumpkin flavor. Very light and drinkable. Light fizzy head, lively but fine-grained carb in mid-palate. Apricot color, mildly sour/tart aroma, dry finish.
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Kick

review_blob:
Draft @ APEX. Hazy golden color, caramelly mouthfeel. Light yet complex hop profile, ranging from floral to orangey to resin, a true hop bomb.
Resiny nose, loose sparkly head, sheets of lace.

Draft @ Apex. Opaque coffee color, off/white head that quickly fades to thin ring and thin lace. Caramel and peppery hops in the aroma, velvety mouthfeel. Subtle peppery hop kick at the end, lots of toast in the finish. Nice CDA, but could be a bit more hoppy.
beer_name: Boneyard / Three Floyds Armored Fist Imperial CDA

review_blob:
Huge burnt caramel, espresso, and super dark chocolate flavors balance and just a touch of peppery hops. Nutty mid-palate, bourbony woody, almost tobacco-y nose and creamy cola-colored head.  almost no lace, but winey legs in the glass.
Big bruiser of an imp Black IPA. Not my usual jam, but very appealing and unusual.
Draft at Hudson. Deliciously tangy apricot-dominated sour. Very clean finish, refined winey nose. Fluffy head recedes to thin ring with very fine-grained lace.
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Le Terroir

review_blob: Amber color, loose creamy head, lace sheets down the side of the glass. Caramelly, toasty body, medium-thick and silky. Piney aroma upfront, followed by a peppery hop bite that mellows to grapefruit and floral notes. Clean aftertaste, last note is a toasty malt.

Hazy golden color, loose head that dissipates quickly, thin rangy lace. Mild carbonation. 
Tart fruits up front with apricot and citrus tang, fades to bready/saltine flavor in the finish.  Crisp finish, tight lemony aroma.

Echoing everything after4ever said.  Super complex hop aroma & flavor - almost a new flavor with every sip. Savory, sweet, citrus, pepper, saffron, I could go on.  Crisp malt profile, light on the tongue, yet carries the hops well.  
This is a beer that might just get me to drop my general bias against NB.
beer_name: New Belgium The Trip X (72 Eldorado Fresh Hop IPA)

review_blob:
On tap at Hopworks pub in SE Portland. 
Light head, clear reddish-gold color. No lace, mild carbonation.
Beautifully balanced, with toffee and spicy malt flavor and crisp citrus & mildly peppery hop kick at the end. A seasonal treat to look forward to all year.

On tap at WM brewpub. The style is actually Belgian IPA, but there was no option for that when adding this.  Really nice spicy and grapefruity aroma, crisp and not overly "belgiany". Flavor is crisp and refreshing, similar to a golden or saison. The flavors are well integrated and complex and they all play nicely together, unlike other belgian IPAs out there.
Golden color, slight chill haze. Nice fluffy white head which dissipates to a thin ring and lingers.

On tap at DM pub.  Opaque reddish toffee color, light head. Lots of loose lace.  Beautiful citrus and floral aroma, followed by snappy and restrained malt profile, clean finish. Much more balanced and pulled-together than the Killer Green, a perennial favorite.

22. Hazy gold color, moderate head that dissipates quickly, no lace.
Medium carbonation. Peppery hops up front, citrus hops in the finish, citrus nose. Excellent and relatively restrained Oregon IPA.

On tap at Lucky Lab NW. Clean finish, nice hop snap, well-balanced.
Excellent example of the marzen style.

22. Classic fresh-hop pale. Resiny hop flavor with a bit of citrus in the nose, but aroma is dominated by grassy and dry leaf notes. Mouthfeel is crisp yet not thin.
Hazy golden-orange color, lively and fine-grained carbonation, minimal head, no lace. Tasted this on tap at the Bridgeport pub as well, and the cirtrus aroma was more prominent.

22. Lightly sweet palate, medium head that recedes in the glass Minimal lace, light carbonation, light hop flavor. Perfect ABV to carry the flavor along.
Excellently rendered ginger flavors in this beer: it has the warmth, fruitiness, and peppery kick of a good fresh knob of ginger. Fruity ginger aroma.
Delicious with spicy Asian foods.
beer_name: Northwest Bad Panda Ginger Pale Ale

review_blob:
On tap @ Horse Brass.  Huge aroma w/ citrus & pineapple. One sniff of the taster sample and I knew that Id order this instead of the fresh-hop beer they had on the list.
Mouthfeel is heavier than youd expect at this ABV. Caramel color & flavor, very well-balanced. Minimal head & lace. Light carb.
Another great beer from Boneyard.

Well-balanced Fresh hop beer w/ Centennial. 
Thin head, light lace. Golden-copper color. 
Juicy mouthfeel, citrusy, grassy nose all at once.
beer_name: 10 Barrel Crosby Farms Harvest Fresh Hop Ale

review_blob: 22. Golden color, light carbonation, thin white head. Toasty malt, lingering peppery hop bite. Clean finish, very drinkable.

On tap at National Pastime pub in National Harbor MD.  Light, floral aroma is the most remarkable trait. Lighter body than expected, pale blonde color. 
Best IPA Ive had from this region.

I bought this having not tasted it in several years, and thus didnt bother to read the label - was shocked to find its only 5.25% ABV. 
Aroma was reminiscent of the macro-lagers of my youth, sweet and a bit hoppy.  Mouthfeel is about what youd expect for the %, thin. 
Hop flavor is mostly peppery, some citrus as well. 
Its a good beer on a hot day, but they should really call this a Pale, especially here in the PNW.

Swing-top bottle from Belmont Station. 
Big, crisp wit aroma, tart fruits and a bit of pepper. Very true to style (pretty strong flavor for the style.) Great summer beer.
